qas.question: Where in the United States was the tank battalion located?
Besides the United States, what other country sent military personnel to Korea?
Who had the fewest number of troops in Korea?
Who was able to counterattack and move the KPA away from the Pusan Perimeter?

context: Meanwhile, U.S. garrisons in <a2_0>Japan<a2_0/> continually dispatched soldiers and matériel to reinforce defenders in the Pusan Perimeter. Tank battalions deployed to Korea directly from the U.S. mainland from the port of <a0_0>San Francisco<a0_0/> to <a1_0>the port of Pusan<a1_0/>, the largest Korean port. By late August, the Pusan Perimeter had some 500 medium tanks battle-ready. In early September 1950, ROK Army and UN Command forces outnumbered the <a3_0>KPA<a3_0/> 180,000 to 100,000 soldiers. The <a4_0>UN forces<a4_0/>, once prepared, counterattacked and broke out of the Pusan Perimeter.
